abstract.p: Sampling of shows and exhibitions in Manhattan that will close soon (S)

block.p: Here is a sampling of shows and exhibitions in Manhattan that are to close soon:

''WINSLOW HOMER'' AND ''AMERICAN PRINTMAKING, 1860-1900: WINSLOW HOMER AND HIS CONTEMPORARIES,'' Metropolitan Museum of Art, Fifth Avenue, at 82d Street. The first, a retrospective with more than 150 drawings, watercolors and oil paintings. The second, 50 lithographs, engravings and etchings. Both through Sunday. Hours: 9:30 A.M. to 8:45 P.M. today and tomorrow; 9:30 A.M. to 5:15 P.M. on Sunday. Admission: $8; $4 for students and the elderly. Information: (212) 535-7710.

''INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL OF PUPPET THEATER,'' through Sunday at various sites. The performance spaces and performers this weekend: Joseph Papp Public Theater, 425 Lafayette Street, East Village, (212) 260-2400 (El Periferico des Objetos, Compagnie Nicole Mossoux and Patrick Bonte, Romann Paska, Mabou Mines, Green Ginger, Evolve Productions, Theater Laku Paka, Alchemilla); La MaMa Etc., 74A East Fourth Street, East Village, (212) 475-7710 (Frantisek and Vera, Warner Blake I and 11); Dance Theater Workshop, 219 West 19th Street, Chelsea, (212) 924-0077 (Janie Geiser and Company); The New Victory Theater, 209 West 42d Street, (212) 563-5544, (Amoros and Augustin); P.S. 122, 150 First Avenue, at Ninth Street, East Village, (212) 477-5288 (Puppet Lounge and Late Night Cabaret). For showtimes and ticket information, call the individual theater or Telecharge, (212) 563-5544.

''IN/SIGHT: AFRICAN PHOTOGRAPHERS, 1940 TO THE PRESENT,'' Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, 1071 Fifth Avenue, at 89th Street. Photographs by 30 African-born artists. Through Sunday. Hours: Today and tomorrow, 10 A.M. to 8 P.M.; Sunday, 10 A.M. to 6 P.M. Admission: $10; $5 for students and the elderly; free for those under 12. Information: (212) 423-3500.
